results.question: Match the term in column 1 to its description in column 2.
results.correct_answer: f. a ribbon that allows you to add or change the appearance of a view
incorrect_answers: c. the right side of the Gantt Chart view
i. a window through which you can see the various elements of a project schedule
j. the dialog box that can be used to format the graphical components of the Gantt Chart view

results.question: True/False: When you make a change to a milestone using the Bar Styles dialog box, the change applies to all milestones in the Gantt chart.
True/False: The Custom Fields dialog box allows the user to change the name of a custom field.
True/False: In Microsoft Project, you can edit predefined tables but you cannot create new custom tables to suit your needs.
True/False: The Gantt Chart view can include only the task data without the bar chart.
True/False: When you make formatting changes to your project schedule, the data does not change, just the way it appears.
True/False: When you add, remove, or rearrange columns or change column widths, you are changing the table's definition.
True/False: You can make almost any custom field part of a calculation for another custom field.
True/False: If you format data using the Font dialog box, the changes apply to only the data you have specifically selected.
True/False: The Gantt Chart Styles has more formatting choices than the Bar Styles dialog box.
True/False: Changing the appearance of data in a view can make it easier to read and understand project data.
